remarks.p: Not all values apply to all FedRAMP artifacts.

allowed-values.description: The FedRAMP Authorization Type
allowed-values.enum: FedRAMP JAB P-ATO
FedRAMP Agency ATO
FedRAMP Tailored for LI-SaaS

allowed-values.description: The cloud service model used by the system.
allowed-values.enum: Infrastructure as a Service
Platform as a Service
Software as a Service
Other

allowed-values.description: Identifies the component type.
allowed-values.enum: A connection to something outside this system.
Any software, operating system, or firmware.
A physical device.
A service that may provide APIs.
An enforceable policy.
A tangible asset used to provide physical protections or countermeasures.
A list of steps or actions to take to achieve some end result.
An applicable plan.
Any guideline or recommendation.
Any organizational or industry standard.
An external assessment performed on some other component, that has been validated by a third-party.
The system as a whole.
An external system, which may be a leveraged system or the other side of an interconnection.
A physical or virtual network.

allowed-values.description: The implementation status of the control.
allowed-values.enum: Implemented
Partially Implemented
Planned
Alternative Implementation
Not Applicable

allowed-values.description: The cloud deployment model.
allowed-values.enum: Public Cloud
Private Cloud
U.S. Government Only
Hybrid
Other

allowed-values.target: system-implementation/component[(@type='service' and not(prop[@name='leveraged-authorization-uuid']) and prop[@name='implementation-point' and @value='external']) or (@type='interconnection') or (@type='service' and prop[@name='implementation-point' and @value='internal'] and prop[@name='direction']) or (@type='software' and prop[@name='asset-type' and @value='cli'] and prop[@name='direction'])]/prop[@name='nature-of-agreement' and @ns='https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal']/@value
allowed-values.formal-name: Nature of Agreement for External Systems
allowed-values.description: Identifies nature of agreement for external systems.
allowed-values.enum: A contract between the CSP and the organization that owns the external system.
An end-user license agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the external system.
An interconnection security agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the external system.
An application license agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the external system.
A memorandum of understanding between the CSP and the organization that owns the external system.
An non-typical agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the external system. Explain in remarks.
A service-level agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the external system.

allowed-values.description: Identifies the FedRAMP version of the document.
allowed-values.enum: FedRAMP Version

allowed-values.description: The system used for categorizing information types.
allowed-values.enum: NIST SP 800-60 Volume 2 Revision 1

allowed-values.description: Identifies the direction of information flow for the interconnection.
allowed-values.enum: Incoming
Outgoing
Bi-Directional

allowed-values.description: Identifies the type of security applied to the interconnection.
allowed-values.enum: IPsec
Virtual Private Network
Transport-Layer Security
Transport-Layer Security
Certificate Authentication Security
Secure File Transfer
Other

allowed-values.description: Indicates if the asset is capable of having an authenticated scan.
allowed-values.enum: Yes
No

allowed-values.description: Indicates if the asset is exposed to the public Internet.
allowed-values.enum: Yes
No

allowed-values.description: Indicates if the asset is virtual.
allowed-values.enum: Yes
No

allowed-values.formal-name: Nature of Agreement for Leveraged Authorizations
allowed-values.description: Identifies nature of agreement for leveraged authorizations.
allowed-values.enum: A contract between the CSP and the organization that owns the leveraged system.
An end-user license agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the leveraged system.
An application license agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the leveraged system.
A memorandum of understanding between the CSP and the organization that owns the leveraged system.
An untypical agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the leveraged system. Explain in remarks.
A service-level agreement between the CSP and the organization that owns the leveraged system.

allowed-values.description: The privilege level of the user.
allowed-values.enum: Read
Read-Write
Write
No Access

allowed-values.description: Identifies the type of scan.
allowed-values.enum: Infrastructure and Operating System Scan
Database Scan
Web Scan
Other

allowed-values.target: //component[(@type='system' and ./prop[@name='leveraged-authorization-uuid']) or (@type='service' and not(./prop[@name='leveraged-authorization-uuid']) and ./prop[@name='implementation-point' and @value='external']) or (@type='interconnection') or (@type='service' and ./prop[@name='implementation-point' and @value='internal'] and ./prop[@name='direction']) or (@type='software' and ./prop[@name='asset-type' and @value='cli'] and ./prop[@name='direction'])]/prop[@ns='https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name='authentication-method']/@value
allowed-values.description: Identifies if user authentication is required.
allowed-values.enum: Yes
No
Not-Applicable

remarks.p: yes: An authentication mechanism exists, and is described in the remarks.
no: An authentication mechanism does not exist, the reason authentication is not necessary is described in the remarks.
not-applicable: The authentication requirement is not applicable, and is described in the remarks.

allowed-values.description: The privilege level of the user.
allowed-values.enum: Read
Read-Write
Write
No Access

allowed-values.description: Sensitivity level of the user.
allowed-values.enum: High Risk
Severe
Moderate
Limited
Not Applicable

allowed-values.description: The type of user.
allowed-values.enum: Internal
External
Privileged

allowed-values.description: The security objective level as defined by NIST SP 800-60.
allowed-values.enum: Low
Moderate
High
